lessons.title: Introduction to HTML
lessons.content:
HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages. HTML describes the structure of a webpage using elements. These elements tell the browser how to display the content. Example: A heading and a paragraph:

This is a heading

This is a paragraph.

subTopics.title: What is HTML?
subTopics.content: HTML (**HyperText Markup Language**) is the standard language for creating web pages. It structures content using elements like headings, paragraphs, images, and links. HTML works with CSS for styling and JavaScript for interactivity..

subTopics.title: Why use HTML?
subTopics.content:
** Defines Structure ** –> Organizes content with headings, paragraphs, lists, etc.

Works with CSS & JavaScript –> CSS styles the page, and JavaScript adds interactivity.

SEO-Friendly –> Helps search engines understand content. 

Universal & Easy  –>  Supported by all browsers and easy to learn. 

Multimedia Support –> Allows images, videos, and audio integration.

lessons.title: HTML Elements
lessons.content: HTML elements are the building blocks of HTML.

lessons.title: HTML Attributes
lessons.content: HTML attributes provide additional information about HTML elements.

lessons.title: HTML Headings
lessons.content: HTML headings are defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags.
